item.title: DOJ releases more Epstein files. And, immigration court 'no-shows' surged, NPR finds
item.description: The DOJ has released more files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. And, NPR finds a rise in the number of immigrants without legal status who aren't showing up to immigration court.

item.title: How systemic failures turn state mental hospitals into prisons
item.description: The share of people with severe mental illness in state psychiatric hospitals accused of serious crimes has risen steeply. The shift has all but halted the possibility of care before a catastrophic crisis.

item.title: Some patients face hurdles getting HIV prevention drugs. Here's what to know

item.title: NPR analysis shows skyrocketing number of 'no-shows' in immigration court
item.description: More immigrants are not showing up for their mandatory immigration court hearings compared to prior years, an NPR analysis shows, allowing the government to order their immediate deportation.
